data.question: What is the pressure range within which the ZnIm crystal undergoes a phase transition from α-phase to β-phase?
What method was used to synthesize ZnIm crystals?
What is the estimated room-temperature bulk modulus for ZnIm?
How does the space group symmetry change during the phase transition of ZnIm?
What is the role of imidazole in the synthesis of ZnIm?
data.answer: Imidazole acts as a bridging ligand connecting Zn2+ ions.

data.question: What is the significance of the cooperative bond rearrangement in the phase transition of ZnIm?
data.answer: It allows for a single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SCSC) transition, indicating that bond breakage and reformation occur in a coordinated manner.

data.question: What experimental technique was primarily used to study the pressure-induced structural evolution of ZnIm?
Why was ZnIm chosen for the high-pressure study?
data.answer: Due to its good diffraction-quality crystals, high symmetry reducing the volume of reciprocal space needed for diffraction experiments, and its well-ordered neutral framework.

data.question: How does the unit cell volume change as a result of the phase transition in ZnIm?
data.answer: There is a decrease in the unit cell volume of 2.1%.

data.question: What is the effect of pressure on the Zn-N bond lengths and N-Zn-N angles before the phase transition?
data.answer: There are no statistically significant changes in the Zn-N bond lengths and N-Zn-N angles with increasing pressure.
